column4: i got ubuntu installed for quite a while... how do i go about re-compiling the kernel? i want it to be compatible to my cpu (its an old p3)
no point in recompiling. Just use a 686 precompiled kernel.
but an 686 kernel version isn't the best compatible with my own cpu, right? i mean its a version compiled on some other cpu, like a p4-2.2ghz or whatever
dont worry about that. The 686 kernel is about the best compatible with your PIII.
